titleInfo.title: Brought to the First District Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the First District Police Prison-- HENRY, a mulatto, about 49 years old, 5 feet 6 inches high ; scar under lower lip ; says he belongs to Mr. Gustave Ducro, near the Battle Ground. JOSEPH JONES, a mulatto, about 22 years old, 5 feet 6 inches high ; says he is free, but supposed to be a slave. LUCIAN, a black, about 36 years old, 6 feet high, lame in right leg, one upper front tooth out; says he belongs to Mr. Lewis Cavashea, 7 miles below Donaldsonville. JOSEPHINE, a light griffe, about 21 years old, 5 feet 1/2 inch high, upper front teeth decayed; says sh ebelongs to Mrs. Sophia Gainar. NewOrleans, April 7 1853 -- 1aw3w J. WORRALL, Warden.
mods.note: Mr. Gustave Ducro; Mr. Lewis Cavashea; Mrs. Sophia Gainar

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
